	<item>
				<title>Compensation Options</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/employee/compensation/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 27 Sep 2013 18:06:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[quantimodo]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://quantimodo.com/?page_id=1866</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[band variation="default"]
<h2>Want to join our team?</h2>
At Quantimodo, the following compensation options are available: [box]
<h3>Option 1: Shared Equity Stake</h3>
[row] [column width="two-third"]
<p dir="ltr">In our ongoing quest to ensure cosmic justice, we would like to compensate anyone who has contributed to the QuantiModo project with a share in the ownership of the company profits that is proportional to the amount of time they have donated to the project relative to the total number of man hours that have been contributed to the project.</p>
<p dir="ltr">In order to obtain an ownership stake, you must do the following:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Log into Wrike.com. If you do not already have an account, e-mail m@quantimodo.com to request one.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Select the root folder in the folder hierarchy. Click “Show Descendants” to show all tasks in all subfolders. Sort tasks by priority.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Always do your tasks in order from highest priority to lowest priority: <a href="https://www.wrike.com/wiki/help/prioritize-tasks">https://www.wrike.com/wiki/help/prioritize-tasks</a></p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">If there is not already a Wrike task for the thing you need to work on:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Go to quantimodo.com/hangout and invite m@quantimodo.com and I can make a task for you.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Alternatively, you can make one for yourself if you know exactly what needs to be done. If you make a task for yourself, be sure to put it in the appropriate folder.</p>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Deliverables must be attached to the task to warrant compensation: <a href="https://www.wrike.com/wiki/help/attach-a-file-to-a-task">https://www.wrike.com/wiki/help/attach-a-file-to-a-task</a></p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Deliverables would include any file that can be attached to the task, such as:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Program Code</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Documents</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Image Files</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Audio Files</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Video Files</p>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Always be very descriptive in your file names and include any terms that someone might use in the future to try to find that file. An unconscionable amount of work has been duplicated due to people not naming files so that they could be easily searched for.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">To upload a new version of a file from your computer, expand the file panel and hover the cursor over the attached file to see the "New version" link. After you finish uploading, Wrike automatically renames the file to follow the original file’s name and avoid confusion. You can view all the previous versions of a file by pressing the small arrow to the left of the file name. To open one of the versions, click on its name in the list.</p>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Track Your Time with Built in Wrike Task Timer: <a href="http://www.wrike.com/blog/Three-two-one-Meet-new-timer">http://www.wrike.com/blog/Three-two-one-Meet-new-timer</a></p>
</li>
</ol>
Whenever you complete a task, fill out and submit the contribution form: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1eeIhwvLLjuOgMKzY_T1N3CKwvoDN7N-qwzNDuALs6Z8/viewform">https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1eeIhwvLLjuOgMKzY_T1N3CKwvoDN7N-qwzNDuALs6Z8/viewform</a> [/column] [column width="one-third"] Desired Expertise [icon_list] [item]HTML 5[/item] [item]CSS 3[/item] [item]Web Standards[/item] [item]PHP[/item] [item]MySQL[/item] [item]JavaScript[/item] [item]Wordpress[/item] [/icon_list] [/column] [/row] [button link="<a href="https://quantimo.do/welcome/help/">https://quantimo.do/welcome/help/</a>"]Apply Now[/button] [/box] [box]
<h3>Option 2: Fixed Cost</h3>
[row] [column width="two-third"]
<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Sign into <a href="http://wrike.com/">wrike.com</a>. (Email <a href="mailto:m@quantimo.do">m@quantimo.do</a> if you need me to make you an account.)</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Select the root folder in the folder hierarchy.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Click “Show Descendants” to show all tasks in all subfolders.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Sort tasks by priority. <a href="https://www.wrike.com/wiki/help/prioritize-tasks">https://www.wrike.com/wiki/help/prioritize-tasks</a></p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Select a high priority task that you are interested in.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Invite <a href="mailto:m@quantimo.do">m@quantimo.do</a> to a google hangout to discuss the details of the task.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">If you still want to do the task after our discussion, assign the task to yourself.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Put all relevant details from our discussion in the task description.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">In the comments of the task, tag <a href="mailto:m@quantimo.do">m@quantimo.do</a>, state how much money you want in exchange for the completion of the task, and state the date when it will be completed.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Set the completion date of the task to the soonest that you think it can be realistically completed.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">I will let you know whether I agree to your terms and timeframe in the comments.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">If I agree to your terms, unassign all others from the task.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Complete the task.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">After completion, mark the task completed and assign it to me.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">In the comments, tag m@quantimo.do and request your payment.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">I will then review the work and decide if it meets the requirements.</li>
	<li dir="ltr">If it does not, I will request modifications.</li>
	<li dir="ltr">If it does meet the requirements, you will receive payment at that time.</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">I will pay you a bonus of 50% of the amount that you bid in the comments of the task if all of the following conditions are met:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">The task is completed by the agreed upon deadline set in the Wrike. For each day past the original deadline the bonus fraction is reduced by 10%.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">Any image or prototype files that you create or modify must be title Always be very descriptive in your file names and include any terms that someone might use in the future to try to find that file.</li>
	<li dir="ltr">If you are programming, <strong>you must commit your code to Github at least once per day</strong> and ideally as many as 10 times per day.  For each day a Github commit is not made from the date of my agreement to your bid until the task is completed, the bonus fraction is reduced by 10%.</li>
	<li dir="ltr">If you are creating images or documents, the names of the files must contain the date in which they we last saved and your initials.  These must be stored in the appropriate folder in Google Drive: <a href="https://drive.google.com/a/quantimo.do/folderview?id=0B5bXsrxQCOy8ZXFia1dSY3IxUXM&amp;usp=sharing">https://drive.google.com/a/quantimo.do/folderview?id=0B5bXsrxQCOy8ZXFia1dSY3IxUXM&amp;usp=sharing</a></li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">You make a DAILY scrum post in the <a href="https://plus.google.com/communities/108781124596014925973/stream/d92d0393-31df-45d4-97ad-1d930fbc34d2">G+ development community</a> every day from the date I agree to your bid in the task until the date it is completed. For each day a SCRUM post is not made, the bonus fraction is reduced by 10%. A scrum post should contain the following:</p>
</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<ul>
<ul>
	<li>Last 24: What you have done in the last 24 hours to advance the project and include links and screenshots illustrating your contributions.
<ul>
	<li>If you have not done anything in the last 24 hours, you still need to make a SCRUM post.  However, you should just include "Last 24: Nothing"</li>
</ul>
</li>
	<li>Next 24: What you plan on doing in the next 24 hours to advance the project.
<ul>
	<li> If you will not be working in the next 24 hours, you should just include "Next 24: Nothing".</li>
</ul>
</li>
	<li>Impediments: Any impediments that you face which you require help with.</li>
</ul>
</ul>
</ul>
[/column] [column width="one-third"] [icon_list] [item]HTML 5[/item] [item]CSS 3[/item] [item]Web Standards[/item] [item]PHP[/item] [item]MySQL[/item] [item]JavaScript[/item] [/icon_list] [/column] [/row] [button link="<a href="https://quantimo.do/welcome/help/">https://quantimo.do/welcome/help/</a>"]Apply Now[/button] [/box]
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Activity Streams</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/citizen-science/activity-streams/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Sep 2013 04:23:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://quantimodo.com/?page_id=2179</guid>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2179</wp:post_id>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

	</item>
	<item>
				<title>Dashboard</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/dashboard/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Oct 2013 02:00:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://quantimo.do/?page_id=2430</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[gap height="80"]

[row]
[column width="two-third" offset="one-sixth"]
<div style="text-align: center;">
<h1 style="margin: 0;">Experiment Dashboard Coming Soon</h1>
<h2 class="h5" style="letter-spacing: 10px; opacity: 0.7;">in 2013</h2>
[hr]

Have you ever tried to improve your health?  Maybe by using a new diet, supplement, exercise regime, medication, or other treatment?

Did you ever wonder if it was actually working?

Many people think they can make this determination using their intuition. However, the human mind is simply not powerful enough to control for all the other countless  uncontrollable variables in life which may also be influencing them. So in order to know if a treatment is really working for you, it is necessary to track treatments and outcomes.

The advent of new technologies are making this self-tracking nearly effortless. However, in isolation the data from these devices is relatively useless. Quantimodo can help by integrating and visualizing this data so you can figure out if your expensive new treatment is actually helping you.

Detailed data analysis can also tell you if a treatment may actually be harming you in formerly imperceptible ways.

The experiment dashboard is where you can keep track of all your experiments. Each thumbnail graph on the dashboard will link to a more detailed analysis page.  All of the previous settings will be restored for you.

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8ell0Z3Nyd3M2czg/edit?usp=sharing"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2651" alt="dashboard" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/dashboard.jpg" width="1440" height="900" /></a>

&nbsp;

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8VlZmNkVKVGhHTmM/edit?usp=sharing"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2652" alt="Dashboard-Page-8-7-12" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Dashboard-Page-8-7-12.jpg" width="1113" height="797" /></a>

&nbsp;

Figuring out what affects your happiness and to what degree requires several steps:

First we integrate the data from all your life-tracking applications and devices.

Next we calculate Pearson Correlation Coefficients  for all input factors (medications, supplements, diet, sleep, weather, noise, light, etc) with a given output state of interest (the most important of which would be mood).

Finally, we will a create  personalized list of factors in order the degree to which they affect you.

The magnitude would be  visualized using a bar graph similar to the effectiveness graphs provided by <a href="http://curetogether.com/depression/treatments/pmi/">CureTogether</a>.

&nbsp;

<a href="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Correlations-Page-Mockup.png"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2457" alt="Correlations Page Mockup" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Correlations-Page-Mockup.png" width="461" height="230" /></a>

&nbsp;

<a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8WHNvZHRSaVdPLTg/edit?usp=sharing">PSD File of Analysis Page (circa 8-6-12)</a> as Shown Below

<a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8WHNvZHRSaVdPLTg/edit?usp=sharing"><img class="size-full wp-image-2531" alt="Analysis-Page-Summer-2012-MPS" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Analysis-Page-Summer-2012-MPS1.jpg" width="781" height="467" /></a>

AI of Analysis Page (circa<img alt="" src="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8bmoyV1VZdnY3Z0U/image?pagenumber=1&amp;w=800" />

</div>
[/column]
[/row]

[gap height="100"]

&nbsp;

	<item>
				<title>Sample Page</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/sample-page/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 24 Nov 2013 04:35:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[quantimodo]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

<blockquote>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like pi&#241;a coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)</blockquote>

...or something like this:

<blockquote>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.</blockquote>

As a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href="http://localhost/wp-admin/">your dashboard</a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
				<title>Edit Data</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/dashboard/edit-data/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 19 Oct 2013 15:38:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://quantimo.do/?page_id=2554</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[gap height="80"] [row] [column width="two-third" offset="one-sixth"]
<div style="text-align: center;">
<h1 style="margin: 0;">Edit Data Option Coming Soon</h1>
<h2 class="h5" style="letter-spacing: 10px; opacity: 0.7;">in 2013</h2>
[hr] To err is human. When self-tracking we inevitably end up with tons of holes in our self tracking data.  You can address this by clicking the Edit Variable Options and Data button underneath the variable selector drop-down boxes.

</div>
<div style="text-align: center;"></div>
<div style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8bmoyV1VZdnY3Z0U/edit?usp=sharing">PSD File of Analysis Page (circa 11-8-12)</a> as Shown Below <a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8bmoyV1VZdnY3Z0U/edit?usp=sharing"><img alt="" src="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8bmoyV1VZdnY3Z0U/image?pagenumber=1&amp;w=800" width="800" height="681" /></a></div>
This should bring you to a screen like this: <a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8U3BPT1dJYjhVRmc/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank">manage-edit-variable-data-and-options.psd</a> <a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5bXsrxQCOy8U3BPT1dJYjhVRmc/edit?usp=sharing"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2555" alt="manage-edit-variable-options-data" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/manage-edit-variable-options-data.jpg" width="798" height="573" /></a>   [/column] [/row] [gap height="100"]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2554</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2013-10-19 15:38:58</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>edit-data</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>2430</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>page_options_slider_shortcode</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>page_options_titlebar_textalign</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[left]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>page_options_show_titlebar_cta</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[-1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>page_options_titlebar_cta_link</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>page_options_titlebar_cta_text</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>page_options_subtitle</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
				<title>Upload Data</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/dashboard/upload-data/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 23 Oct 2013 19:38:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://quantimo.do/?page_id=2599</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[gap height="80"]

[row]
[column width="two-third" offset="one-sixth"]
<div style="text-align: center;">
<h1 style="margin: 0;">Manual Data Upload Coming Soon</h1>
<h2 class="h5" style="letter-spacing: 10px; opacity: 0.7;">in 2013</h2>
[hr]
<div>The user clicks an “Upload Spreadsheet” button.
The “File Open” dialog pops up and the user browses and clicks on the .csv, .xls, or .xlsx that they want to upload.
The user clicks OK.
<p dir="ltr">Back on the page, the user indicates what type of spreadsheet they will be uploading by selecting one of the following options from a drop down menu. (The source data spreadsheets will be exported from various life tracking android apps or web apps.  The different websites and apps all have different formats in which they output their data. That is why the user needs to indicate where the data is from.)</p>
<p dir="ltr">Exported Data Type Options in Drop Down Menu:</p>
<p dir="ltr">Fitbit</p>
Export from fitbit.com
Contains data about the body, exercise, and sleep on different sheets.
Example of this Exported Spreadsheet Format: <a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/fitbit_export_20120703.xls">https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/fitbit_export_20120703.xls</a>
After uploading, the server should extract Columns A and K from Activities Sheet and add to the server database.
<p dir="ltr">MyNetDiary</p>
Diet Export from mynetdiary.com
<a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/MyNetDiaryReport.xls">Example of this Exported Spreadsheet Format: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/MyNetDiaryReport.xls</a>
Columns A and D through AY and add to the server database.
<p dir="ltr">Tap Log</p>
(Android App) Export
This app can track whatever you want
<a href="https://www.odesk.com/leaving_odesk.php?ref=https%253A%252F%252Fdocs.google.com%252Fspreadsheet%252Fccc%253Fkey%253D0AteZ14sZB7x_dC0tM1p0SDNBTjN4RHVGZDVkdk95S1E">Example of this Exported Spreadsheet Format: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AteZ14sZB7x_dC0tM1p0SDNBTjN4RHVGZDVkdk95S1E</a>
Extract columns A, B, E, and F and add to the server database.
The category is indicated in column B. It’s going to be tougher because, each category does not have it’s own column. The data in each row is for a different category.
<p dir="ltr">MedHelper</p>
(Android App) Export
Tracks Medication Intake
<a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/medhelper%20%285%29.xls">Example of this Exported Spreadsheet Format: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/medhelper%20%285%29.xls</a>
Extract columns C, D, and G and add to the server database.
<p dir="ltr">Good Day Journal</p>
(Android App) Export
Tracks Mood
Here’s one where the date is broken into 3 columns so they probably need to be combined in a single date field in the database
<a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/Day_Record_Info.csv">Example of this Exported Spreadsheet Format: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/Day_Record_Info.csv</a>
Extract columns A through D and add to the server database.
<p dir="ltr">Custom Spreadsheet I Made Myself</p>
This tracks intelligence and mood
<a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/Day_Record_Info.csv">Example of this Exported Spreadsheet Format:</a> <a href="https://www.odesk.com/leaving_odesk.php?ref=https%253A%252F%252Fdocs.google.com%252Fspreadsheet%252Fccc%253Fkey%253D0AteZ14sZB7x_dG8yWU5PVGNfX1kyNzFsWnA4TW5YS3c">https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AteZ14sZB7x_dG8yWU5PVGNfX1kyNzFsWnA4TW5YS3c</a>
Extract columns columns A through H and add to the server database.
<p dir="ltr">DataHabit (Android App) Export</p>
Tracks various aspects of mood
<a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/DataHabit.csv">https://dl.dropbox.com/u/482604/DataHabit.csv</a>
Extract columns A through C and add to the server database.
The category is indicated in column A. It’s going to be tougher because, each category does not have it’s own column. The data in each row is for a different category.
<p dir="ltr"></p>
The data is transformed as necessary so that the database consists of numerous tables, each containing a date field and one or more STATE or INPUT value fields.

The user should have the ability to come back later and upload more data to the database and see the new graph.
The user should also have the ability to download all previously uploaded data in the form of a csv or xls spreadsheet.  This spreadsheet would have Column A for a date column and row 1 would be a  header row.  Each input or output would have its own column.


Deliverables Required: Ability to upload spreadsheet data in a wide array of file formats including XLS, CSV, and XLSX.
<p dir="ltr">Required: The ability to select from a drop down menu of various source applications to indicate allowing the program to know which columns must be extracted and how data must be transformed to add to the database.</p>
Optional: Allow user to upload spreadsheet without selecting an application format.  The server would examine the spreadsheet to find unique characteristics that allow it to determine which application produced the export
<p dir="ltr"></p>

</div>
</div>
[/column]
[/row]

[gap height="100"]]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
				<title>API Specification</title>
		<link>http://utopia.quantimodo.com/employee/api/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Nov 2013 14:35:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[mike_sinn]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://quantimo.do/?page_id=2673</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Try it out for yourself with our super-neat API explorer here:  <a href="https://quantimo.do/api/docs/">https://quantimo.do/api/docs/</a>

The QuantiModo API currently outputs a JSON encoded array of measurements. These measurements are recorded by the user using various life tracking applications, and are grouped over a certain time period. The screenshot below illustrates an example dataset.
<div><dl id=""><dt><img alt="" src="http://i.imgur.com/BQF0aNQ.png?1" width="1032" height="448" /></dt><dd>Graph without Substitution for Missing Data</dd></dl></div>
For some variables (like “5 Htp” in the above figure), the absence of records for a given time period should be assumed to be a specific value. For instance, for each day without measurements for this specific requested medication variable, a value of 0 should be returned by the API, with the timestamp of that day, resulting in a graph like this.
<div><dl id=""><dt><img alt="" src="http://i.imgur.com/LU2YaZD.png" width="1032" height="448" /></dt><dd>Graph with substitution for missing data</dd></dl></div>
You can try out the site for yourself here: <a href="https://quantimo.do/dashboard/correlations/">https://quantimo.do/dashboard/correlations/</a>

user: quantimodo

pw: qB1ggerstaff!q

&nbsp;

Here is our current API: <a href="https://github.com/mikepsinn/Quantimodo-API-PHP">https://github.com/mikepsinn/Quantimodo-API-PHP</a>  (email m@quantimo.do if you need to be added as a collaborator)

Here is our database schema:

<a href="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/quantimodo-v4.1-database-tables-relationships-mapping-fields-db-schema-2.jpg"><img alt="quantimodo v4.1 database tables relationships mapping fields db schema 2" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/quantimodo-v4.1-database-tables-relationships-mapping-fields-db-schema-2.jpg" width="790" height="311" /></a>

You will be responsible for modifying our current API filter out measurements for a given variable, within a specific timespan that are likely to be erroneous, average/sum the measurements that are not filtered out.  If no acceptable measurements are present within the given timespan, then the API should return the "filling-value" set in the qm-variable-user-settings" table instead.  This is further illustrated in the flow chart below.
<h2>Isn't this how we should be getting the array for the points on the scatterplot?</h2>
<ul>
	<li>the get measurements method should be called a total of [ (endtime - starttime)/groupingwidth ] times.</li>
	<li>Each time it would add a new value to the array.</li>
	<li>The first time it would select all records with value*conversionfactor &gt;= minimum AND value*conversionfactor &lt;= maximum AND timestamps &gt;= (starttime + i*grouping width) AND timestamp &lt; [starttime + (i + 1)<em>groupingwidth] WHILE i &lt; [ (endtime - starttime)/groupingwidth ]</em>
<ul>
	<li><em>If there are records produced by this query, it would convert them all to si and average or sum them and put the resultant value in the array.</em></li>
	<li><em>If there are no records produced, it would add the filling-value</em>24hours/groupingwidth to the array.</li>
</ul>
</li>
	<li>Then it would then increment i.</li>
	<li>It would then repeat this process for the output state and put those values in the second row (y-coordinates on the scatterplot) of our 2 dimensional array.</li>
</ul>
If you want to edit the flow chart, you can download it here: <a href="https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B5bXsrxQCOy8WHN3THdRRHROUUk&amp;usp=sharing">https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B5bXsrxQCOy8WHN3THdRRHROUUk&amp;usp=sharing</a>

you probably have to install the gliffy chrome app, then download the attached file and open the local copy.  After editing, please save it with the date in the filename and send it to m@quantimo.do.

&nbsp;

<a href="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/Flow-Chart-For-Measurement-Filtering-Substitution-Prioritization-and-Grouping1.jpg"><img alt="Flow Chart For Measurement Filtering, Substitution, Prioritization, and Grouping" src="https://quantimo.do/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/Flow-Chart-For-Measurement-Filtering-Substitution-Prioritization-and-Grouping1.jpg" width="1270" height="2120" /></a>

&nbsp;

The interval and value (filling-value) of these generated measurements are defined by the user settings, and stored in a separate MySQL table qm-variable-user-settings.

Edit Google Doc Here: <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#">https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#</a>

&nbsp;

<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.t6h2l9mxscsc">3.7.1 Request</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.t3ly648ih7p3">3.7.2 Response</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.w8ysla591ewv">3.TODO discover more AJAX calls from analysis page, and pages that will be migrated from the original Spring server to Wordpress.</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.22ftmawd8sy3">Appendix: Objects</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.hzl63zep818r">QuantimodoRecord</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.c9h6woel7v68">QuantimodoVariable</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.j50f9p2lk023">QuantimodoCategory</a></p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#heading=h.60tyjk6rmhvc">User</a></p>
<p dir="ltr">This document contains the specifications for the Quantimodo application programming interface (API) that native applications (MediModo, MoodiModo, QuantiMobile, NeuroModo) and the Quantimodo web application (Wordpress) can use to communicate with the mySQL backend. If any other methods are required, feel free to add and document them.</p>
&nbsp;
<h1 dir="ltr">Transport</h1>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">To save bandwidth requests should be compressed using an algorithm all supported platforms can use. Java’s Inflate/Deflate algorithm or GZIP are both valid options.</p>
&nbsp;
<h1 dir="ltr">1 API Summary</h1>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">1.1 What the API does and does not</h2>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">1.1.1 No Wordpress Logout</h3>
<p dir="ltr">No API is needed for Wordpress user logout. The a client is responsible for deleting its cookies so that users will be able to login again.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">GET /login</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /user-id</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/user-info { “user-id”: 55, “user-role”: “ROLE_USER” }</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET</p>
<p dir="ltr">/records/ GET(variableId)</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET(variableId, startTime)</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET(variableId, startTime, endTime)</p>
<p dir="ltr">POST(quantimodoRecordsJson)</p>
<p dir="ltr">/categories</p>
<p dir="ltr">/input/ GET()</p>
<p dir="ltr">/output/ GET()</p>
<p dir="ltr">/variables</p>
<p dir="ltr">/input/ GET(categoryId)</p>
<p dir="ltr">/output/ GET(categoryId)</p>
<p dir="ltr">/correlations</p>
<p dir="ltr">&lt;TODO&gt;</p>
<p dir="ltr">/connectors</p>
<p dir="ltr">&lt;TODO&gt;</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">1.2 URL Ending</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">The URL for a newly designed API shall end with slash (/). It usually isn’t the case for a legacy API.</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">1.3 Paging</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Pagination is the ability to limit the size of the returned data as well as retrieve a specified subset of a large data set. Pagination has two key concepts: limit and offset. Limit is the restriction on the maximum number of items for that type that can be returned. Offset is the starting point for the return data. For example, an offset of 50 specifies that the items that are returned should start with item number 51 (since the numbering is one-based) in the collection.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">It’s required to have paging for APIs that return a list of objects. The following are the common parameters for paging.</p>

<ul>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">offset - the starting point for the return data</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">length - the restriction on the maximum number of items for that type that can be returned</p>
</li>
</ul>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">In the response, there are properties to indicate if there are more objects to return on next page.</p>

<ul>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">more - true/false</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">offset</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">length</p>
</li>
</ul>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Note for client application (Wordpress/Android/iOS...) developers: for simplicity of the document, neither the parameters nor the properties will be specially addressed again.</p>
<img alt="" src="https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/eMcMw4f9fd0aCxExXNMBppCz0F6zC-32TkolF-EuOClrmZiPUJArp931Pa9gK6_0MFWrdXNOZDCAB4LtmJ02UrBO3WX-LLCYpIwHhFjusNalxohAtxfjLSWD" width="618px;" height="691px;" />
<h2 dir="ltr">1.4 Naming</h2>
&nbsp;
<ul>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Method names starting with List indicate a list with paging is returned.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Those starting with find returns a single object.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h1 dir="ltr">2 Methods</h1>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Note to backend Java developers: Spring MVC controllers are located in the package</p>
<p dir="ltr">com.quantimodo.api.server.http</p>

<h2 dir="ltr">2.1 Authentication</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Quantimodo clients, i.e. Wordpress web client (Javascript), Android and iOS mobile clients shall redirect browser to this url. Technically, this is not an API for Java backend. It’s a contract between Wordpress and mobile clients.</p>
<p dir="ltr">The url handler shall be implemented in Wordpress. It will redirect immediately to an identity provider.</p>
<p dir="ltr">Another url handler shall be implemented in Wordpress to redirect user back to successReturnUrl or failureReturnUrl based on the result.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">To authenticate using a third-party service:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Make a GET request to <a href="http://quantimodo.com/auth/service/google">http://quantimodo.com/auth/service/</a>yourservice</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p dir="ltr">A valid service would be “google” or “twitter. A full list can be found on singly.com</p>

<ol start="2">
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Monitor your web client, the user will be redirected numerous times. Make sure the device stays responsive and let the user know something is working behind the scenes.</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">Eventually the user reaches <a href="http://quantimodo.com/auth/service">http://quantimodo.com/auth/service</a> again, you’ll get a bunch of cookies here. One of these is required for authentication with the API server, it should look similar to this: wordpress_logged_in_a23f0h9fa23fh982</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">To verify the user is succesfully logged in you can optionally make a request to <a href="https://quantimodo.com/user_id/">https://quantimodo.com/user_id/</a>. If everything is all right you’ll get the id of the currently logged in user.</p>
</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">For username and password based authentication make a POST request to:</p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="http://quantimodo.com/wp-login.php">http://quantimodo.com/wp-login.php</a></p>
<p dir="ltr">with the following form data:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">log: USERNAME</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">pwd: PASSWORD</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">wp-submit: Log In</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">redirect_to:</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">testcookie: 1</p>
</li>
</ol>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Registration is pretty similar, a POST request to:</p>
<p dir="ltr"><a href="https://quantimodo.com/wp-login.php?action=register">https://quantimodo.com/wp-login.php?action=register</a></p>
<p dir="ltr">With the following form data:</p>

<ol>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">user_login: USERNAME</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">user_email: EMAIL</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">redirect_to:</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">wp-submit: Register</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p dir="ltr">Note for API Java developers: The API relays all the cookies found at the root path to Wordpress on requesting <a href="https://quantimodo.com/user_id/">https://quantimodo.com/user_id/</a>. See</p>
<p dir="ltr">com.quantimodo.api.server.security.WordpressCookieAuthenticateFilter.autoLogin(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Clients (Javascript/Android/iOS) do NOT need to make requests to https://quantimodo.com/user_id/. Instead, they should request https://quantimodo.com/api/user/ to verify if the login is successful, or to retrieve the user id. /user_id/ was for Java backend, not for clients.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Note to backend (Java) developers: please read <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BfEyaw-TgvEylc6-oBl-Ncoa-fOFTmCXOdvMJpFPnjg/edit#">MySQL Tables - Google Drive</a>.</p>
<img alt="" src="https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/aJn9P77nJkp1OBQO8riZB6Xc5wAy_JPfQmDRoNiogLs_ZyRiT1Cy04Jxb1-Pmv85GspTf0XOhW5aRLZhaXsbb9VgHAnFaYEincYRpjRPnuvHECwVYPHeWcuz" width="643px;" height="283px;" /><img alt="" src="https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/6eg3LfSciaTjkqss5S83jclaYMInoyEQAiClFRs33WnVXlLtbKsYQGulXJkkvkihur1RYVf3EGW5balXysP01TwF72qdMScnKWl0_X4vpxUyc9OI3l_efLFx" width="625px;" height="282px;" />
<h3 dir="ltr">2.1.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /auth/service/{provider} HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">provider</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">Effective values:</p>

<ul>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">google</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">facebook</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">twitter</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">msn</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">(TODO) append more</p>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">successReturnUrl</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">The url to redirect to after the authentication is successful.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">failureReturnUrl</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">The url to redirect to after the authentication is failed.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.1.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 302 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Headers</p>
<p dir="ltr">Location: { successReturnUrl | failureReturnUrl } &lt;the url to an identity provider’s authentication web page&gt;</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.2 User information</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Gets information of the current user. Either they are authenticated or anonymous. Mobile or Javascript clients can decide whether to redirect the user to the <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.g4jruu7rw7de">authentication url</a> after calling this API.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#user-information">https://quantimodo.com/api/#user-information</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.2.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/user/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.2.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample response for anonymous users. (It’s 200 rather than 401 so that it’s easier to read with chrome developer tools.)</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">   error: "Login required.",</p>
<p dir="ltr">   agent: "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/27.0.1453.110 Safari/537.36"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample response for authenticated users.</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">   agent: "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/27.0.1453.110 Safari/537.36",</p>
<p dir="ltr">   user: {</p>
<p dir="ltr">       username: "0",</p>
<p dir="ltr">       roles: [</p>
<p dir="ltr">           "ROLE_USER"</p>
<p dir="ltr">       ]</p>
<p dir="ltr">   }</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.3 API logout</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Invalidate the session on API server. API session timeout is one minute. Clients should logout from API on user logout from Wordpress.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#logout">https://quantimodo.com/api/#logout</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.3.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/logout/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.3.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 302 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Headers</p>
<p dir="ltr">Location: http://quantimodo.com/api/401/</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.4 List all available records for a given variable ID</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get all available records for a given variable ID.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-records">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-records</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.4.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/records/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variableId</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">The variable the records belong to.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.4.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample.</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"records" : [ {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 101831,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"guestId" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"variableId" : 1135,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"value" : 3.5,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"startTimeUTC" : "Jan 29, 2013",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"durationInSeconds" : 86400</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 101832,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"guestId" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"variableId" : 1135,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"value" : 3.5,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"startTimeUTC" : "Jan 30, 2013",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"durationInSeconds" : 86400</p>
<p dir="ltr">} ],</p>
<p dir="ltr">"more" : true,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"offset" : 0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"length" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"userId" : "5"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>
&nbsp;
<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">records</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">An array of <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.evdaqxz0xadm">QuantimodoRecord</a> objects.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.5 List all available records from startTime to now for a given variable ID</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get all available records from startTime to now for a given variable ID</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-records2">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-records2</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.5.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/records/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variableId</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">The variable the records belong to.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">startTime</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">An long integer representing date time.</p>
<p dir="ltr">In Javascript and Java, you can get such a value with</p>
<p dir="ltr">new Date().getTime()</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.5.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">(same as <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.o4prn3py4bo">2.4.2</a>)</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.6 List all available records from startTime to endTime for a given variable ID</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get all available records from startTime to endTime for a given variable ID.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-records3">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-records3</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.6.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/records/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variableId</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">The variable the records belong to.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">startTime</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">An long integer representing date time.</p>
<p dir="ltr">In Javascript and Java, you can get such a value with</p>
<p dir="ltr">new Date().getTime()</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">endTime</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.6.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">(same as <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.o4prn3py4bo">2.4.2</a>)</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.7 Save records</h2>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.7.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">POST /api/records/medimodo/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">2.7.1.1</p>
<p dir="ltr">POST /api/records/moodimodo/</p>
<p dir="ltr">timestamp</p>
<p dir="ltr">moodrating</p>
<p dir="ltr">anxiety rating</p>
<p dir="ltr">determined rating</p>
<p dir="ltr">scared rating</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">2.7.1.2</p>
<p dir="ltr">POST /api/records/medimodo/</p>
<p dir="ltr">Medication Name</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">(quantimodoRecordsJson) returns ???</p>
<p dir="ltr">???</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.7.2 Response</h3>
<p dir="ltr">Specific API for specific requirements</p>
<p dir="ltr">Not necessary,</p>

<h2 dir="ltr">2.8 List user input data categories</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get all available input categories and IDs for which authenticated user has data.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-categories-input">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-categories-input</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.8.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/categories/input/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.8.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"categories" : [ {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 18,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Physical Activity"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 29,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Social Interactions"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 70,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "test_output"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 21,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "[Miscellaneous]"</p>
<p dir="ltr">} ],</p>
<p dir="ltr">"more" : false,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"offset" : 0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"length" : 1000,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"userId" : "0"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">categories</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">An array of <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.jjtoy4huyqc">QuantimodoCategory</a> objects</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.9 List user output data categories</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get all available output categories and IDs for which authenticated user has data.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-categories-output">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-categories-output</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.9.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/categories/output/ HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">2.9.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">(same as <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.jqjk2r77abz2">2.8.2</a>)</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">2.TODO expand the document with the following APIs</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">/api/x/</p>
<p dir="ltr">xxxxx</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">/api/categories/all (low priority)</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET() returns QuantimodoCategory</p>
<p dir="ltr">Get all categories</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">/api/categories/input/all (low priority)</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET() returns QuantimodoCategory</p>
<p dir="ltr">Get all input categories (including categories that can be both)</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">/api/categories/output/all (low priority)</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET() returns QuantimodoCategory</p>
<p dir="ltr">Get all output categories (including categories that can be both)</p>
<p dir="ltr">/api/variables/input/ returns QuantimodoVariable</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET(categoryID)</p>
<p dir="ltr">Get all available input variables and ID’s for a given category.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">/api/variables/output/ returns QuantimodoVariable</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET(categoryID)</p>
<p dir="ltr">Get all available input variables and ID’s for a given category</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get the user’s medications and schedule and previous administration data and put it in MediModo so they don’t have to reënter all their prescription data again.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">get the user’s previous mood tracking data.</p>

<h1 dir="ltr">3 Legacy Methods -</h1>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">It’s currently used by analysis page. (You can see it with Chrome developer tools and firebug.)</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">TODO how to determine if the list is complete here?</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Note to backend Java developers: legacy Spring MVC controllers are located in the package</p>
<p dir="ltr">com.fluxtream.api</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.1 Find variable settings</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#find-variable-settings">https://quantimodo.com/api/#find-variable-settings</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.1.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /analyze/variables_settings/get HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.1.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"inputType" : "AGGREGATED",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"inputId" : 1733791,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"inputCategory" : 69,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"outputType" : "AGGREGATED",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"outputId" : 1733782,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"outputCategory" : 73,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"grouping" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "month",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"value" : 4</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.2 List user data categories (legacy)</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Get all available categories and IDs for which authenticated user has data.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-categories">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-categories</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.2.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/categories HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.2.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">(same as <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.jqjk2r77abz2">2.8.2</a>)</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.3 List aggregated variables (legacy)</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">It’s currently used by analysis page. (You can see it with Chrome developer tools and firebug.)</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-aggregated-variables">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-aggregated-variables</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.2.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/variables/aggregated HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.2.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"variables" : [ {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733730,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "1",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"categoryId" : 1,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733786,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "1",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"categoryId" : 1,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">} ],</p>
<p dir="ltr">"more" : false,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"offset" : 0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"length" : 100</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Note to Wordpress developers: it’s not in the legacy format. Please update the Javascript to retrieve the array from the property of variables, instead of taking the whole response body as the array.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variables</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">An array of <a href="https://docs.google.com/a/quantimo.do/document/d/12kHhBPUgjp43oGCdi-xxN_qXKMC9OTKE8ZFs-Ka1IaU/edit#bookmark=id.u1w4ny5kcdbn">QuantimodoVariable</a> objects.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.4 List variable values</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, <a href="https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-variable-values">https://quantimodo.com/api/#list-variable-values</a></p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.4.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/variables/values HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">var_type</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">Effective values:</p>

<ul>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">AGGREGATED</p>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">var_id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">from</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">Text representing date in the format of</p>
<p dir="ltr">Jul 2, 2013</p>
<p dir="ltr">It accepts an empty value, i.e. a zero-length string.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">to</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">See the parameter, from</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">grouping</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">?</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.4.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1135,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Mood",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"applicationId" : 8,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"application" : "Good Day Journal",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"categoryId" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"categoryName" : "Mood",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"unitDto" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 35,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"siUnit" : 83,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"siUnitsPerThisUnit" : 20.0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "5 star rating"</p>
<p dir="ltr">},</p>
<p dir="ltr">"keepZeroes" : false,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"timeShift" : 0.0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"timeShiftUnit" : 0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"filling" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"type" : "IS_MISSING"</p>
<p dir="ltr">},</p>
<p dir="ltr">"grouping" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "month",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"value" : 4</p>
<p dir="ltr">},</p>
<p dir="ltr">"type" : "SINGLE",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : true,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"prioritizedVariables" : [],</p>
<p dir="ltr">"remainingVariables" : [],</p>
<p dir="ltr">"groupedValues" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1338508800000" : 2.9583333333333335,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1341100800000" : 2.6666666666666665,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1354320000000" : 3.0833333333333335,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1356998400000" : 3.4,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1359676800000" : 3.730769230769231,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1362096000000" : 3.892857142857143,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"1364774400000" : 3.7</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.5 Update variable settings</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, …</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.5.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">POST /api/analyze/variables_settings/save</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">input_id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">input_type</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">output_id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">output_type</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">grouping</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.5.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"result" : "OK",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"message" : "Successfully saved guest variable settings!"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.6 Category (legacy)</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, …</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.5.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/categories/category/{categoryId} HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">All their existing data for that application</p>
<p dir="ltr">medications</p>
<p dir="ltr">mood ratings</p>
<p dir="ltr">medication schedules</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>
<p dir="ltr">n/a</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.6.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 69,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Medications",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"variables" : [ {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733790,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Chamomile",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733791,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Melatonin",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733720,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "single_var1",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">} ]</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">name</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">dataOwner</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">global</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variables</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">An array of QuantimodoVariable objects (?)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variables[i].id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variables[i].dataOwner</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variables[i].name</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variables[i].global</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">3.7 Aggregated variables</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Demo page, …</p>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.7.1 Request</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Request-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">GET /api/variables/aggregated/all HTTP/1.1</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Params</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">behavior</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">Effective values:</p>

<ul>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">input</p>
</li>
	<li dir="ltr">
<p dir="ltr">output (?)</p>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h3 dir="ltr">3.7.2 Response</h3>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Status-Line</p>
<p dir="ltr">HTTP/1.1 200 OK</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Message Body</p>
<p dir="ltr">JSON</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">[ {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733730,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Acetyl-L-Carnitine",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"unitDto" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 15,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"siUnit" : 13,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"siUnitsPerThisUnit" : 0.0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "mg",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"useAverage" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">},</p>
<p dir="ltr">"type" : "AGGREGATED",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">}, {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733786,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Adderall",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"unitDto" : {</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 15,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"siUnit" : 13,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"siUnitsPerThisUnit" : 0.0,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "mg",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"useAverage" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">},</p>
<p dir="ltr">"type" : "AGGREGATED",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">} ]</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description (on array elements)</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">dataOwner</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">name</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">unitDto.id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">unitDto.siUnit</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">unitDto.siUnitsPerThisUnit</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">unitDto.name</p>
</td>

</tr>

</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 dir="ltr">3.TODO discover more AJAX calls from analysis page, and pages that will be migrated from the original Spring server to Wordpress.</h2>
<h1 dir="ltr"></h1>
<h1 dir="ltr">Appendix: Objects</h1>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">QuantimodoRecord</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">TODO add the properties here. Please refer com.quantimodo.etl.QuantimodoRecord</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Holds a single data point</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 101831,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"guestId" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"variableId" : 1135,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"value" : 3.5,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"startTimeUTC" : "Jan 29, 2013",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"durationInSeconds" : 86400</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">id</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">Record ID</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">guestId</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">Fluxtream guest ID</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">variableId</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">value</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">startTimeUTC</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">durationInSeconds</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">QuantimodoVariable</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Contains information defining a single input or output variable</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 1733730,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "1",</p>
<p dir="ltr">"categoryId" : 1,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"dataOwner" : 2,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"global" : false</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">categoryId</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">dataOwner</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">global</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">type</p>
</td>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">AGGREGATED</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">QuantimodoCategory</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Contains information defining a single input or output category</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">"id" : 18,</p>
<p dir="ltr">"name" : "Physical Activity"</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Description</p>

<div dir="ltr">
<table><colgroup> <col width="*" /> <col width="*" /></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">id</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">name</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<p dir="ltr">t</p>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2 dir="ltr">User</h2>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Contains information of the currently authenticated user.</p>
&nbsp;
<p dir="ltr">Sample.</p>
<p dir="ltr">{</p>
<p dir="ltr">   agent: "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/27.0.1453.110 Safari/537.36",</p>
<p dir="ltr">   user: {</p>
<p dir="ltr">       username: "0",</p>
<p dir="ltr">       roles: [</p>
<p dir="ltr">           "ROLE_USER"</p>
<p dir="ltr">       ]</p>
<p dir="ltr">   }</p>
<p dir="ltr">}</p>]]></content:encoded>
